job_to_be_done.task: Prepare a vegetarian,gluten-free buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering.

metadata.enhanced_query_used:
1. "Preparing a delicious and nutritious vegetarian, gluten-free buffet-style menu for a corporate gathering is our top priority."

2. "Our team of experienced chefs will work tirelessly to ensure that each dish is perfectly balanced and flavorful."

3. "We will also ensure that the menu is accessible to all dietary restrictions, including vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options."

4. "We will provide a variety of appetizers, entrees, and desserts to cater to all tastes and preferences."

5. "Our menu will be designed to be both visually appealing and healthy, with options that are both nutritious and satisfying."

6. "We will also ensure that our menu is sustainable and eco-friendly, using locally sourced ingred

• 1 pound chicken breast, sliced • 1 bell pepper, sliced • 1 small onion, sliced • 2 tablespoons fajita seasoning • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil • Tortillas for serving • Shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheese, sour cream, and salsa for toppings In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. • Cook sliced chicken, bell pepper, and onion until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender. • Stir in fajita seasoning and cook for an additional 2 minutes. • Serve chicken and vegetables in tortillas with desired toppings.

o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 1 egg o 1 teaspoon oregano o 1 teaspoon mint o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Oil for frying o Mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, beaten egg, oregano, mint, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Form mixture into meatballs. o Heat oil in a pan and fry meatballs until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

• 2 pounds pork shoulder • 1 small onion, sliced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 cup barbecue sauce • 1/2 cup chicken broth • 1 tablespoon brown sugar • 1 teaspoon smoked paprika • Salt and pepper to taste • Buns for serving • Coleslaw for topping (optional) • Season pork shoulder with salt, pepper, and smoked paprika. • Place onion and garlic in a slow cooker, then add pork. • Mix barbecue sauce, chicken broth, and brown sugar, and pour over pork. • Cook on low for 8 hours or high for 4 hours until pork shreds easily. • Shred pork with forks and mix with sauce. • Serve on buns with coleslaw if desired.

• 1 pound chicken breast, cubed • 1/2 pound sausage, sliced • 1/2 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 bell pepper, diced • 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes • 1 cup chicken broth • 1 cup long-grain rice • 1 teaspoon paprika • 1 teaspoon thyme • 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Cook cubed chicken and sliced sausage until browned, then set aside. • Stir in diced tomatoes, chicken broth, rice, paprika, thyme, cayenne pepper, salt, and In the same pot, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. pepper. • Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. • Add shrimp and cooked chicken and sausage, simmer for an additional 10 minutes until shrimp is cooked and rice is tender. • Serve warm.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 4 slices turkey breast 1/2 apple, thinly sliced 1/4 cup baby spinach 1 tablespoon mustard or mayo • Spread mustard or mayo on one slice of bread. • Layer the turkey, apple slices, and spinach on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

o 4 tomatoes o 1 cucumber o 1 small red onion o 1 bell pepper o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Dice tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and bell pepper. o Blend vegetables with minced garlic, olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper until smooth. o Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.

o 1 pound paneer o 1/2 cup yogurt o 1 tablespoon lemon juice o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon garam masala o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o Skewers o Cut paneer into cubes. o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, garam masala, turmeric, and salt in a bowl. o Add paneer cubes and marinate for at least 1 hour. o Thread paneer onto skewers. o Grill or broil until golden, turning occasionally. o Serve warm.

o 1 onion o 2 carrots o 2 celery stalks o 2 cloves garlic o 1 zucchini o 1 can diced tomatoes o 4 cups vegetable broth o 1 can cannellini beans o 1 cup pasta o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese o Sauté diced onion, carrots, celery, and minced garlic until softened. o Add diced zucchini, tomatoes, and broth. o Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes. o Add beans and pasta, cook until pasta is tender. o Stir in chopped basil and serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

• 1 pound ground beef • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 can (14.5 ounces) enchilada sauce • 1 cup shredded cheese • 8 tortillas • 1 teaspoon cumin • 1 teaspoon chili powder • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil • Salt and pepper to taste In a skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). • Cook ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. • Stir in cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. • Fill tortillas with beef mixture and roll up. • Place enchiladas in a baking dish and pour enchilada sauce over the top. • Sprinkle with shredded cheese. • Bake for 20-25 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. • Serve warm.

o 1 cup rice flour o 1/2 cup coconut milk o 1/2 cup water o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 pound pork o 1 small onion o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying o Mix rice flour, coconut milk, water, turmeric, and salt to form a batter. o Sauté sliced pork, shrimp, and diced onion until cooked. o Heat oil in a pan and pour in a ladle of batter, swirling to coat the pan. o Add cooked pork, shrimp, bean sprouts, green onions, and cilantro. o Fold pancake in half and cook until crispy. o Serve with lettuce and dipping sauce.

• 9 lasagna noodles, cooked • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 zucchini, sliced • 1 bell pepper, diced • 1 cup spinach, chopped • 1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce • 1 can (15 ounces) ricotta cheese • 1 egg • 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese • 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sauté onion, garlic, zucchini, and bell pepper until tender. Add spinach and cook until wilted. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, salt, and pepper. In a baking dish, spread a thin layer of marinara sauce. Layer 3 noodles, half the ricotta mixture, half the vegetables, and 1/3 of the mozzarella. Repeat layers. • Top with remaining noodles, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese. • Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20 minutes until bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

• 2 large eggs 1/4 cup shredded cheese 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon 1/4 cup diced bell pepper 1/4 cup diced onions • 2 small flour tortillas • Salsa for serving In a bowl, whisk the eggs and cook them in a skillet over medium heat. • Add cheese, sausage or bacon, onions and bell pepper to the eggs. • Cook until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender. • Divide the egg mixture between the tortillas. • Serve with salsa.

• 1 pound ground lamb or beef • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 cup frozen peas and carrots • 1 cup beef broth • 2 tablespoons tomato paste • 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce • 4 cups mashed potatoes • 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese • Salt and pepper to taste In a skillet, cook ground lamb or beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. • Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). • Stir in peas and carrots, beef broth, tomato paste, and Worcestershire sauce. • Simmer until thickened, season with salt and pepper. • Transfer meat mixture to a baking dish. • Spread mashed potatoes over the top and sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese. • Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and bubbly. • Serve warm.
In a bowl, combine the chicken, mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, celery, and grapes. • Season with salt and pepper. • Serve in lettuce leaves.

o 1 green papaya o 2 tomatoes o 1 carrot o 2 cloves garlic o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon peanuts o 1-2 Thai chilies o Peel and shred green papaya and carrot. o Crush garlic and chilies in a mortar and pestle. o Add fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar, mix well. o Toss shredded papaya, carrot, and sliced tomatoes with the dressing. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve.

• 1 pound pork tenderloin, cubed • 1 bell pepper, diced • 1 small onion, diced • 1/2 cup pineapple chunks • 1/4 cup ketchup • 1/4 cup rice vinegar • 1/4 cup soy sauce • 1/4 cup brown sugar • 2 tablespoons cornstarch • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil • Cooked rice for serving In a bowl, toss pork cubes with cornstarch. • Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. • Cook pork until browned and crispy, then set aside. • Stir in pineapple chunks, ketchup, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and brown sugar. • Return pork to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce. • Serve over cooked rice. In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and bell pepper until softened.

• Top with remaining noodles, marinara sauce, mozzarella, and Parmesan cheese. • Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil and bake for another 20 minutes until bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a large bowl, mix ground beef, ground pork, diced onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, milk, beaten egg, ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. • Shape the mixture into a loaf and place in a baking dish. • Bake for 1 hour until cooked through. 1 large flour tortilla • 2 large eggs • Salsa for serving 1/4 cup shredded cheese 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon 1/4 cup diced bell pepper • • • In a bowl, whisk the eggs and cook them in a skillet over medium heat. • Add cheese, sausage or bacon, and bell pepper to the eggs. • Cook until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender. • Place the egg mixture on one half of the tortilla and fold the other half over. • Cook in the skillet until the tortilla is golden brown and crispy. • Serve with salsa.

• 2 slices whole grain bread • 4 slices turkey breast 1/2 avocado, sliced 1/2 cup spinach leaves 1 tablespoon mustard or mayo • Spread mustard or mayo on one slice of bread. • Layer the turkey, avocado, and spinach on top. • Top with the second slice of bread and cut in half.

o 1 green papaya o 2 carrots o 1/4 cup peanuts o 1/4 cup cilantro o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons lime juice o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1-2 Thai chilies o Peel and shred green papaya and carrots. o Crush peanuts and chop cilantro. o Mix fish sauce, lime juice, sugar, and sliced chilies in a bowl. o Toss shredded papaya, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro with the dressing. o Serve chilled.

• 4 veal shanks • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 cup white wine • 2 cups beef broth • 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes • 1 carrot, diced • 1 celery stalk, diced • 1 teaspoon thyme • 1 bay leaf • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). • Season veal shanks with salt and pepper, then brown on all sides. • Remove veal shanks and set aside. In the same pot, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, diced carrot, and diced celery until softened. • Stir in white wine, beef broth, diced tomatoes, thyme, and bay leaf. • Return veal shanks to the pot and bring to a simmer. • Cover and transfer to the oven. • Cook for 2 hours until veal is tender. • Serve warm.

o 2 cups cassava flour o 1/4 cup butter o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup bacon o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon salt o Sauté diced bacon, onion, and minced garlic in butter until crispy. o Add cassava flour and cook, stirring constantly, until golden. o Stir in chopped parsley and salt. o Serve warm.

In a bowl, whisk the eggs and cook them in a skillet over medium heat. • Add cheese, sausage or bacon, bell pepper, and onion to the eggs. • Cook until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender. • Place the egg mixture in the center of the tortilla and roll it up. • Serve with salsa.

• 4 pork chops • 2 apples, sliced • 1 small onion, sliced • 1/4 cup apple cider • 1/4 cup chicken broth • 2 tablespoons butter • 1 tablespoon olive oil • 1 teaspoon thyme • Salt and pepper to taste In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Season pork chops with salt and pepper. • Cook pork chops until browned on both sides, then set aside. • Stir in apple cider, chicken broth, and thyme. • Return pork chops to the skillet and simmer for 10 minutes until cooked through. • Serve warm. In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. • • • Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque. • Stir in cooked bacon and sliced green onions. • Serve shrimp mixture over grits.

o 1 pound chicken breast o 1/4 cup coconut milk o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons peanut butter o 1 tablespoon curry powder o 1 tablespoon brown sugar o Skewers o Cut chicken into strips and thread onto skewers. o Mix coconut milk, soy sauce, peanut butter, curry powder, and brown sugar in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 1 hour. o Grill or broil until cooked through. o Serve with peanut sauce.

In a bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, sugar, sake, grated ginger, and minced garlic. • Marinate chicken thighs in the mixture for at least 30 minutes. • Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. • Cook chicken thighs until browned and cooked through. • Pour marinade into the skillet and simmer until thickened. • Serve chicken over cooked rice, garnished with sliced green onions.

o 2 red bell peppers o 1/2 cup walnuts o 1/4 cup breadcrumbs o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 tablespoon pomegranate molasses o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt o Roast bell peppers until charred, then peel and seed. o Blend peppers, walnuts, breadcrumbs, minced garlic, olive oil, pomegranate molasses, cumin, and salt in a food processor until smooth. o Serve with pita bread.

o 2 cups flour o 1/2 cup butter o 1/4 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olives o 1/4 cup raisins o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying o Mix flour, butter, water, and beaten egg to form a dough, then let rest. o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped olives, and raisins with cumin, paprika, and salt until cooked. o Roll out dough and cut into circles. o Place a spoonful of filling on each circle and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

• 1 pound chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces • 1/4 cup soy sauce • 1/4 cup mirin • 1/4 cup sake • 2 tablespoons sugar • Bamboo skewers • Sliced green onions for garnish In a bowl, mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar. • Marinate chicken pieces in the mixture for at least 30 minutes. • Thread chicken onto bamboo skewers. • Preheat grill to medium-high heat. • Grill chicken, brushing with marinade, until cooked through. • Garnish with sliced green onions and serve.

o 1 pie crust o 6 slices bacon o 1 small onion o 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese o 3 eggs o 1 cup heavy cream o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 teaspoon pepper o Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). o Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble. o Sauté diced onion in bacon fat until softened. o Place pie crust in a pie dish and sprinkle with bacon, onion, and cheese. o Beat eggs with cream, salt, and pepper, then pour over the filling. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Serve warm.

• 1 pound white fish fillets (such as cod or tilapia) • 1/2 cup flour • 1/2 cup cornmeal • 1 teaspoon paprika • 1 teaspoon cumin • 1 teaspoon salt • 1/2 teaspoon pepper • 1/2 cup buttermilk • 1/4 cup vegetable oil • Taco shells or tortillas • Shredded cabbage, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, and lime wedges for toppings In a bowl, mix flour, cornmeal, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper. • Dip fish fillets in buttermilk, then coat with the flour mixture. • Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. • Cook fish until golden and cooked through. • Serve fish in taco shells or tortillas with desired toppings.

o 4 bananas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 2 tomatoes o 1 cup coconut milk o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes and cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in coconut milk, sliced bananas, salt, and pepper. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve warm.

• 4 cups chicken broth • 1/4 cup soy sauce • 2 tablespoons miso paste • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 piece ginger, sliced • 1/2 pound pork belly, sliced • 4 eggs, soft-boiled • 8 ounces ramen noodles • Sliced green onions, nori, and sesame seeds for garnish In a large pot, bring chicken broth, soy sauce, miso paste, minced garlic, and sliced ginger to a boil. In a skillet, cook sliced pork belly until crispy. • Reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes. • Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions. • Divide noodles among bowls, top with broth, pork belly, soft-boiled eggs, sliced green onions, nori, and sesame seeds. • Serve immediately.

o 1 cup ground egusi seeds o 1/2 pound beef o 1/2 pound fish o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup palm oil o 1 teaspoon crayfish powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups water o 1/4 cup spinach o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in palm oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, ground egusi seeds, and crayfish powder, cook for 5 minutes. o Add beef, fish, salt, pepper, and water, simmer until meat is tender. o Stir in chopped spinach and cook for 5 minutes. o Serve warm.

• 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced • 2 cups broccoli florets • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1/4 cup soy sauce • 1/4 cup beef broth • 2 tablespoons oyster sauce • 1 tablespoon cornstarch • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil • Cooked rice for serving In the same skillet, sauté diced onion and minced garlic until fragrant. In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, beef broth, oyster sauce, and cornstarch. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. • • • Add broccoli florets and stir-fry until tender. • Return beef to the skillet and pour sauce over the top. • Cook until sauce is thickened. • Serve over cooked rice.

o 4 corn tortillas o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 cups chicken broth o 2 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 avocado o 1/4 cup cilantro o Cut tortillas into strips and fry in oil until crispy. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in a pot until translucent. o Add diced tomatoes and cumin, cook for 5 minutes. o Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Simmer for 10 minutes. o Serve soup topped with tortilla strips, diced avocado, and chopped cilantro.

• 1 pound ground beef • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 packet taco seasoning • 1/2 cup water • Taco shells or tortillas In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. • Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until softened. • Stir in taco seasoning and water, simmer until thickened. • Serve beef mixture in taco shells or tortillas with desired toppings.

o 1 block tofu o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon chili bean paste o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon rice wine o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1/4 cup chicken broth o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o Cut tofu into cubes and set aside. o Sauté ground pork, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. o Add chili bean paste, soy sauce, rice wine, and sugar, cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and tofu, simmer for 5 minutes. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the pan, stirring until thickened. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

o 4 eggs o 1 cup water o 1/4 cup green onions o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil o Beat eggs with water, salt, and chopped green onions. o Pour mixture into a heatproof bowl. o Steam for 10-15 minutes until set. o Drizzle with sesame oil and serve warm.

1/2 cup diced potatoes 1/4 cup diced bell pepper 1/4 cup diced onion 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon • 2 large eggs • • • • • Salt and pepper to taste 1 tablespoon olive oil • Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. • Add potatoes, bell pepper, and onion, and cook until tender. • Add sausage or bacon and cook until heated through. • Make two wells in the mixture and crack an egg into each well. • Cover and cook until the eggs are set. • Season with salt and pepper. • Serve immediately.

1 can chickpeas, drained and rinsed 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1/2 cucumber, diced 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • • • • • • 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

o 4 flour tortillas o 2 cups shredded cheese o 1/2 cup diced cooked chicken (optional) o 1/4 cup chopped cilantro o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil o Heat oil in a pan. o Place a tortilla in the pan and sprinkle with cheese, chicken, and cilantro. o Top with another tortilla. o Cook until cheese is melted and tortilla is golden, then flip and cook the other side. o Cut into wedges and serve.

• 8 slices bread • 4 slices cheddar cheese • 4 slices mozzarella cheese • 1/4 cup butter • Preheat a skillet over medium heat. • Butter one side of each slice of bread. • Place a slice of cheddar cheese and a slice of mozzarella cheese between two slices of bread, buttered side out. • Cook sandwiches in the skillet until golden brown and cheese is melted. • Serve warm.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 bell pepper, sliced • 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes • 1/2 cup chicken broth • 1/4 cup red wine • 1 teaspoon dried oregano • 1 teaspoon dried basil • 1/4 cup olives, sliced • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Add chicken thighs and cook until browned on both sides, then set aside. In the same skillet, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and sliced bell pepper until softened. • Stir in diced tomatoes, chicken broth, red wine, oregano, basil, and olives. • Return chicken to the skillet and simmer for 30 minutes until chicken is cooked through. • Season with salt and pepper to taste. • Serve warm.

1 cup dates, pitted 1 cup mixed nuts 1/4 cup dried fruit 1 tablespoon honey • • • • In a food processor, combine dates, mixed nuts, dried fruit, and honey. • Process until the mixture comes together. • Press the mixture into a greased baking dish. • Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before cutting into bars. • Store in an airtight container.

o 1 package dumpling wrappers o 1/2 pound ground pork o 1/2 cup chopped cabbage o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 cloves garlic o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 teaspoon sesame oil o Oil for frying o Mix ground pork, cabbage, green onions, minced garlic, soy sauce, and sesame o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and fold to seal. o Fry in hot oil until golden, then steam for 5 minutes. o Serve with dipping sauce.

• 1 pie crust • 6 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled • 1 small onion, diced • 1 cup grated Gruyère cheese • 3 eggs • 1 cup heavy cream • 1/2 teaspoon salt • 1/4 teaspoon pepper • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). • Place pie crust in a pie dish. • Sprinkle cooked bacon, diced onion, and grated Gruyère cheese over the crust. • Pour egg mixture over the filling. • Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. • Serve warm. In a bowl, whisk eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper.

o 1 pound pork shoulder o 1/2 cup duck fat o 1/4 cup white wine o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Cut pork into small pieces. o Cook pork with duck fat, wine, thyme, salt, and pepper in a pot over low heat until very tender (about 3 hours). o Shred pork with a fork and pack into jars. o Chill until set. o Serve with bread.

• 1 pound ground beef • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 jar (24 ounces) marinara sauce • 1 can (15 ounces) ricotta cheese • 1 egg • 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese • 1 teaspoon dried basil • 1 teaspoon dried oregano • 9 lasagna noodles, cooked • 2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese In a skillet, cook ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until browned. • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). • Stir in marinara sauce and simmer for 10 minutes. In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese, egg, grated Parmesan cheese, basil, and oregano. Layer with 3 lasagna noodles, 1/3 of the ricotta mixture, 1/3 of the meat sauce, and 1/3 of the shredded mozzarella cheese. • Repeat layers twice more. • Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes. • Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly. • Spread a thin layer of meat sauce in a baking dish.

• 1 pound white fish fillets (such as cod or haddock) • 1 cup flour • 1 cup beer • 1 teaspoon baking powder • 1 teaspoon salt • 1/2 teaspoon pepper • 4 large potatoes, peeled and cut into fries • Vegetable oil for frying In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. • Gradually whisk in beer until smooth. • Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C). • Dip fish fillets in the batter and fry until golden and crispy. • Drain on paper towels. • Fry potatoes until golden and crispy. • Serve fish and chips with lemon wedges.

o 4 tomatoes o 1 pound fresh mozzarella o 1/4 cup basil o 2 tablespoons olive oil o 1 tablespoon balsamic glaze o 1 teaspoon salt o Slice tomatoes and mozzarella. o Arrange on a plate, alternating slices. o Sprinkle with chopped basil, olive oil, balsamic glaze, and salt. o Serve immediately.

• 2 large eggs 1/4 cup shredded cheese 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon 1/4 cup diced bell pepper 1/4 cup diced onion 1 large flour tortilla • • • • In a bowl, whisk the eggs and cook them in a skillet over medium heat. • Add cheese, sausage or bacon, bell pepper, and onion to the eggs. • Cook until the eggs are set and the vegetables are tender. • Place the egg mixture in the center of the tortilla and roll it up. • Serve with salsa.

o 1 package rice paper wrappers o 1/2 pound shrimp o 1/2 cup rice vermicelli o 1/2 cup lettuce o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup basil o 1/4 cup carrots o 1/4 cup cucumber o Cook shrimp and slice in half. o Cook rice vermicelli according to package instructions, then drain. o Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until pliable. o Place a small amount of shrimp, vermicelli, lettuce, mint, cilantro, basil, julienned carrots, and cucumber on each wrapper. o Roll tightly and serve with dipping sauce.

o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 cucumber o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1 teaspoon salt o Dice tomatoes, onion, and cucumber. o Mix vegetables with chopped cilantro, lemon juice, and salt. o Serve chilled.

In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Brown chicken thighs on all sides, then set aside. • Sauté onion and garlic until softened. • Stir in cumin, cinnamon, and turmeric, then add chicken broth, apricots, and olives. • Return chicken to the pot, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes until tender. • Season with salt and pepper. • Garnish with parsley and serve over couscous.

o 4 potatoes o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/2 cup tomato sauce o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper o 1/2 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup mayonnaise o Peel and dice potatoes. o Toss potatoes with olive oil and salt, then roast at 400°F (200°C) until crispy. o Mix tomato sauce, paprika, and cayenne pepper in a bowl. o Serve potatoes with tomato sauce and a dollop of mayonnaise.

• 1/2 pound chicken breast, cubed • 1/2 pound shrimp, peeled and deveined • 1/2 pound mussels, cleaned • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 bell pepper, diced • 1 cup short-grain rice • 2 cups chicken broth • 1/2 cup white wine • 1/4 cup olive oil • 1 teaspoon saffron • 1 teaspoon paprika • Salt and pepper to taste In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Cook cubed chicken until browned, then set aside. In the same skillet, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. • Stir in rice, chicken broth, white wine, saffron, paprika, salt, and pepper. • Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. • Add shrimp, mussels, and cooked chicken, simmer for an additional 10 minutes until seafood is cooked and rice is tender. • Garnish with lemon wedges and serve.

o Assorted cured meats (salami, prosciutto) o Cheeses (mozzarella, provolone) o Olives o Marinated vegetables (artichokes, peppers) o Breadsticks o Arrange meats, cheeses, olives, and vegetables on a platter. o Serve with breadsticks.

o 1 jar grape leaves o 1 cup rice o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1/4 cup currants o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt o Rinse grape leaves and pat dry. o Sauté diced onion in olive oil until translucent. o Add rice, pine nuts, and currants, cook for 5 minutes. o Add 1 cup water, lemon juice, and salt, simmer until rice is tender. o Place a spoonful of rice mixture on each grape leaf and roll tightly. o Arrange dolmas in a pot, cover with water, and simmer for 30 minutes. o Serve warm or chilled.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts • 1/4 cup flour • 1/4 cup lemon juice • 1/4 cup chicken broth • 1/4 cup capers • 2 tablespoons butter • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste • Chopped parsley for garnish • Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour. In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat. • Cook chicken until golden and cooked through, then set aside. In the same skillet, add lemon juice, chicken broth, and capers, simmer until reduced by half. • Return chicken to the skillet and coat with the sauce. • Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

o 2 cups rice o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 4 tomatoes o 1/4 cup tomato paste o 1/4 cup vegetable oil o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon curry powder o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 4 cups chicken broth o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in vegetable oil until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, curry powder, salt, and pepper, cook for 5 minutes. o Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. o Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. o Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm.

o 4 tomatoes o 1 small onion o 1 jalapeño o 1/4 cup cilantro o 1 lime o 1 teaspoon salt o Dice tomatoes, onion, and jalapeño. o Chop cilantro. o Combine all ingredients in a bowl. o Squeeze lime juice over the mixture and add salt. o Mix well and serve.

1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1/2 cup cucumber, diced 1/4 cup black olives, sliced 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 2 cups cooked pasta (such as rotini or penne) • • • • • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar In a large bowl, combine the pasta, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts • 1 pound fettuccine • 1 cup heavy cream • 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese • 1/4 cup butter • 2 cloves garlic, minced • Salt and pepper to taste • Chopped parsley for garnish • Cook fettuccine according to package instructions. In a skillet, melt butter over medium heat. • Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant. • Add chicken breasts and cook until golden and cooked through. • Remove chicken from the skillet and set aside. • Pour heavy cream into the skillet and bring to a simmer. • Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth. • Season with salt and pepper. • Slice chicken and return to the skillet. • Toss cooked fettuccine with the sauce and chicken. • Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

o 4 carrots o 1/4 cup raisins o 1/4 cup parsley o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon salt o Grate carrots and mix with raisins and chopped parsley. o Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, cumin, and salt, then pour over salad. o Toss well and serve chilled.

o 1 can chickpeas o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon coriander o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup flour o Oil for frying o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, diced onion, minced garlic, chopped parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt in a food processor. o Add flour and mix until combined. o Form mixture into balls and fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve.

• 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced • 8 cups beef broth • 1 small onion, sliced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 piece ginger, sliced • 2 star anise • 1 cinnamon stick • 1 tablespoon fish sauce • 1 tablespoon soy sauce • 8 ounces rice noodles • Fresh basil, cilantro, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and sliced jalapeños for garnish In a large pot, bring beef broth to a boil. • Add sliced onion, minced garlic, sliced ginger, star anise, and cinnamon stick. • Simmer for 30 minutes. • Stir in fish sauce and soy sauce. • Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. • Divide noodles and thinly sliced beef among bowls. • Pour hot broth over the top. • Garnish with fresh basil, cilantro, bean sprouts, lime wedges, and sliced jalapeños. • Serve immediately.

o 1 cup bulgur o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup pine nuts o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon allspice o 1 teaspoon salt o Oil for frying o Soak bulgur in water until tender, then drain. o Mix bulgur with ground beef, diced onion, pine nuts, cumin, allspice, and salt. o Form mixture into balls or patties. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve.

• 4 pork cutlets • 1/2 cup flour • 2 eggs, beaten • 1 cup breadcrumbs • 1/4 cup vegetable oil • 1 lemon, sliced • Salt and pepper to taste • Season pork cutlets with salt and pepper. • Dredge cutlets in flour, dip in beaten eggs, and coat with breadcrumbs. • Cook cutlets until golden and crispy on both sides. • Serve with lemon slices. In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.

o 1 cup Arborio rice o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup white wine o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese o 2 tablespoons butter o 1 tablespoon olive oil o Heat broth in a pot and keep warm. o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic in olive oil until translucent. o Add rice and cook until lightly toasted. o Pour in wine and cook until absorbed. o Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed. o Continue until rice is creamy and tender. o Stir in butter and grated Parmesan cheese. o Serve immediately.

• 4 slices turkey breast • 4 slices cheese (such as cheddar or Swiss) 1/2 cup baby spinach 1/4 cup hummus • • • Lay a slice of turkey flat and spread with hummus. • Place a slice of cheese and a few spinach leaves on top. • Roll up tightly and repeat with remaining ingredients.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. • Cook cubed chicken until browned, then set aside. In the same skillet, sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. • Stir in rice, chicken broth, white wine, saffron, paprika, salt, and pepper. • Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. • Add shrimp, mussels, and cooked chicken, simmer for an additional 10 minutes until seafood is cooked and rice is tender. • Garnish with lemon wedges and serve.

• 1 pound crab meat • 1 small onion, diced • 1/4 cup breadcrumbs • 1/4 cup mayonnaise • 1 egg, beaten • 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard • 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce • 1 teaspoon Old Bay seasoning • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil Lemon wedges for serving In a bowl, mix crab meat, diced onion, breadcrumbs, mayonnaise, beaten egg, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and Old Bay seasoning. • Form mixture into patties. In a skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. • Cook crab cakes until golden and crispy on both sides. • Serve with lemon wedges.

o 3 avocados o 1 lime o 1 small onion o 2 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon salt o 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro o 1 teaspoon minced garlic o Cut avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. o Mash the avocados with a fork. o Add lime juice, diced onion, chopped tomatoes, salt, cilantro, and garlic. o Mix well and serve immediately.

1 cup cooked lentils 1/2 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1/2 cucumber, diced 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • • • • • • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar In a large bowl, combine the lentils, tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and red wine vinegar. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

• 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cubed • 1/4 cup cornstarch • 1/4 cup soy sauce • 1/4 cup rice vinegar • 1/4 cup hoisin sauce • 2 tablespoons sugar • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 teaspoon grated ginger • 1/4 cup vegetable oil • Cooked rice for serving • Sliced green onions for garnish In a bowl, toss chicken cubes with cornstarch. • Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat. • Cook chicken until golden and crispy, then set aside. • Stir in soy sauce, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, and sugar, simmer until thickened. • Return chicken to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce. • Serve over cooked rice, garnished with sliced green onions. In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic and grated ginger until fragrant.

o 1 pound chicken thighs o 1/4 cup yogurt o 2 tablespoons lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Mix yogurt, lemon juice, minced garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, salt, and pepper in a bowl. o Marinate chicken in the mixture for at least 2 hours. o Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). o Arrange chicken on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes until cooked through. o Slice and serve with pita bread and toppings.

o 8 ounces wide rice noodles o 1/2 pound chicken breast o 1 cup broccoli o 2 eggs o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons oyster sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon vegetable oil o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté sliced chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. o Scramble eggs in the same pan. o Add noodles, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sugar, stir to combine. o Add broccoli and cooked chicken, stir-fry until heated through. o Serve warm.

1 large whole wheat tortilla 1/4 cup hummus 1/4 cup shredded carrots 1/4 cup sliced cucumber 1/4 cup baby spinach 1/4 cup sliced bell pepper • • • • • • • Spread hummus on the tortilla. • Layer with shredded carrots, cucumber, spinach, and bell pepper. • Roll up the tortilla tightly. • Slice in half and serve.

• 1 pound fettuccine • 1 cup heavy cream • 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese • 1/4 cup butter • 2 cloves garlic, minced • Salt and pepper to taste • Chopped parsley for garnish • Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant. • Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. • Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth. • Season with salt and pepper. • Toss cooked fettuccine with the sauce. • Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

o 1 bunch spinach o 2 tablespoons sesame seeds o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon mirin o Blanch spinach in boiling water, then rinse in cold water and squeeze out excess moisture. o Toast sesame seeds and grind them. o Mix sesame seeds with soy sauce, sugar, and mirin. o Toss spinach with dressing and serve.

o 1/2 pound ground beef o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup parsley o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon cinnamon o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o 1 package phyllo dough o 1/4 cup butter o Oil for frying o Sauté ground beef, diced onion, and minced garlic until cooked. o Stir in chopped parsley, cumin, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. o Cut phyllo dough into strips and brush with melted butter. o Place a spoonful of filling on each strip and fold into triangles. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve warm.

1 can tuna, drained 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1/4 cup cucumber, diced 1/4 cup black olives, sliced 1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled • • • • • • 2 tablespoons olive oil 1 tablespoon lemon juice • Salt and pepper to taste In a bowl, combine the tuna, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta cheese. • Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice. • Season with salt and pepper, then toss to combine.

o 1 pound chicken o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon turmeric o 1 teaspoon ginger o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/4 cup lentils o 1/4 cup cilantro o 4 pieces flatbread o Sauté chicken, diced onion, and minced garlic in olive oil until browned. o Add cumin, turmeric, ginger, and salt, cook for 1 minute. o Add chicken broth and lentils, simmer until chicken is cooked and lentils are tender. o Stir in chopped cilantro. o Tear flatbread into pieces and place in a serving dish. o Pour chicken and sauce over the bread and serve warm.

• 8 ounces rice noodles • 1/2 pound shrimp or chicken • 2 eggs • 1 cup bean sprouts • 1/4 cup peanuts, chopped • 2 tablespoons fish sauce • 2 tablespoons tamarind paste • 1 tablespoon sugar • 1 tablespoon lime juice • 1/4 cup green onions, chopped • 2 tablespoons vegetable oil • Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. • Sauté shrimp or chicken in vegetable oil until cooked, then set aside. • Scramble eggs in the same pan. • Add noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and lime juice, stir to combine. • Add bean sprouts, cooked shrimp or chicken, and chopped green onions. • Garnish with chopped peanuts and serve.

1/2 cup cooked quinoa 1/4 cup black beans, rinsed and drained 1/4 cup diced avocado 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1 large egg, poached or fried • • • • • • Salt and pepper to taste 1 tablespoon olive oil In a bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, avocado, and cherry tomatoes. • Top with the poached or fried egg. • Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. • Serve immediately.

o 4 cups chicken broth o 1/2 cup sliced mushrooms o 1/4 cup bamboo shoots o 1/4 cup tofu o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 2 tablespoons rice vinegar o 1 tablespoon cornstarch o 1 teaspoon chili paste o 1 egg o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o Bring chicken broth to a boil. o Add mushrooms, bamboo shoots, tofu, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili paste. o Mix cornstarch with water and add to the soup, stirring until thickened. o Beat egg and slowly pour into the soup, stirring constantly. o Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

• 1 pound spaghetti • 4 eggs • 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese • 1/2 cup pancetta, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1/4 cup heavy cream (optional) • Salt and pepper to taste • Chopped parsley for garnish In a skillet, cook diced pancetta until crispy, then set aside. In a bowl, whisk eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and heavy cream (if using). In the same skillet, sauté minced garlic until fragrant. • Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. • Add cooked spaghetti and toss to coat. • Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, pancetta, salt, and pepper. • Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.
o 1 cup lentils o 1/2 cup chickpeas o 1 small onion

1 whole wheat tortilla 1/2 cup shredded cheese 1/4 cup bell pepper, sliced 1/4 cup zucchini, sliced 1/4 cup red onion, sliced • • • • • • Lay the tortilla flat and sprinkle half of the cheese on one side. • Add the bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion. • Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top and fold the tortilla in half. • Cook in a skillet over medium heat until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is golden brown. • Slice into wedges.

o 1 baguette o 4 tomatoes o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt o Slice baguette and toast until golden. o Rub toasted bread with cut garlic cloves. o Grate tomatoes and spread on bread. o Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. o Serve immediately.

o 8 ounces rice noodles o 1/2 pound shrimp o 2 eggs o 1 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup peanuts o 2 tablespoons fish sauce o 2 tablespoons tamarind paste o 1 tablespoon sugar o 1 tablespoon lime juice o 1/4 cup green onions o Soak rice noodles in warm water until softened, then drain. o Sauté shrimp in a pan until cooked, then set aside.

o 2 cups sugar o 1 cup coconut o 1/4 cup butter o 10 egg yolks o 1 teaspoon vanilla extract o Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). o Mix sugar, coconut, melted butter, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a bowl. o Pour mixture into greased muffin tins. o Bake for 30-35 minutes until set and golden. o Let cool before removing from tins. o Serve chilled.

o 4 potatoes o 1 small onion o 1/4 cup bacon o 2 tablespoons butter o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/2 teaspoon pepper o Boil potatoes until tender, then slice. o Cook diced bacon until crispy, then remove and set aside. o Sauté sliced potatoes and diced onion in butter until golden. o Stir in bacon, salt, and pepper. o Serve warm.

• 4 slices of bread • 2 large eggs 1/2 cup milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 tablespoon butter • • In a shallow dish, whisk together eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon. • Dip each slice of bread into the egg mixture, coating both sides. • Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and melt the butter. • Cook the bread slices until golden brown on both sides. • Serve with syrup and powdered sugar.

o 1 package egg roll wrappers o 1 cup shredded cabbage o 1/2 cup grated carrots o 1/2 cup bean sprouts o 1/4 cup chopped green onions o 2 tablespoons soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil o Oil for frying o Mix cabbage, carrots, bean sprouts, green onions, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl. o Place a spoonful of filling on each wrapper and roll tightly. o Fry in hot oil until golden. o Drain on paper towels and serve with dipping sauce.

o 1 can chickpeas o 1/4 cup tahini o 1/4 cup lemon juice o 2 cloves garlic o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1 teaspoon salt o Drain and rinse chickpeas. o Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and salt in a food processor. o Slowly add olive oil while blending until smooth. o Serve with a drizzle of olive oil.

• 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined • 1/4 cup olive oil • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 lemon, juiced • 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped • Salt and pepper to taste • Bamboo skewers In a bowl, mix olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper. • Preheat grill to medium-high heat. • Thread shrimp onto bamboo skewers. • Brush the mixture over the shrimp. • Grill shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side until pink and opaque. • Serve warm.

o 1 cup yogurt o 1/2 cucumber o 1/4 cup mint o 1/4 teaspoon cumin o 1/4 teaspoon salt o Grate cucumber and squeeze out excess moisture. o Mix yogurt with cucumber, chopped mint, cumin, and salt. o Serve chilled.

• 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts • 1/2 cup spinach, chopped • 1/2 cup feta cheese, crumbled • 1/4 cup sun-dried tomatoes, chopped • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste In a bowl, mix spinach, feta, sun-dried tomatoes, and garlic. • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). • Cut a pocket into each chicken breast. • Stuff the mixture into the chicken pockets and secure with toothpicks if needed. • Season chicken with salt and pepper. • Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sear chicken on both sides. • Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through. • Serve warm.

1 pre-made pizza crust 1/2 cup marinara sauce 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese • • • • 2 large eggs 1/4 cup cooked sausage or bacon 1/4 cup diced bell pepper • • • Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). • Spread marinara sauce over the pizza crust. • Sprinkle mozzarella cheese on top. • Crack the eggs onto the pizza. • Add sausage or bacon and bell pepper. • Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the eggs are set and the cheese is melted. • Serve immediately.

o 4 cups dashi broth o 1/4 cup miso paste o 1/2 cup tofu o 1/4 cup green onions o 1/4 cup seaweed o Heat dashi broth until warm. o Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of broth, then add to the pot. o Add diced tofu and seaweed. o Simmer for 5 minutes. o Garnish with sliced green onions and serve.

o 1 cup rice o 1 cup coconut milk o 1 cup water o 1/2 cup kidney beans o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 teaspoon thyme o 1 teaspoon salt o Sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened. o Add rice, coconut milk, water, kidney beans, thyme, and salt. o Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until rice is tender. o Serve warm.

• 4 salmon fillets • 1 lemon, sliced • 1 small onion, sliced • 1 zucchini, sliced • 1/4 cup olive oil • 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped • Salt and pepper to taste • Parchment paper • Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). • Cut parchment paper into large squares. • Place a salmon fillet in the center of each square. • Top with lemon slices, sliced onion, and sliced zucchini. • Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with chopped dill, salt, and pepper. • Fold the parchment paper over the salmon and seal the edges to form a packet. • Place packets on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until salmon is cooked through. • Serve warm.

• 4 bell peppers, tops cut off and seeds removed • 1 pound ground beef • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 cup cooked rice • 1 can (14.5 ounces) diced tomatoes • 1 cup shredded cheese • 1 teaspoon oregano • 1 teaspoon basil • 2 tablespoons olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste

• 2 pounds beef chuck, cut into cubes • 1 small onion, diced • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 cup red wine • 2 cups beef broth • 1 cup mushrooms, sliced • 1 cup carrots, sliced • 1 cup pearl onions • 2 tablespoons tomato paste • 2 tablespoons flour • 2 tablespoons butter • 1 teaspoon thyme • 1 bay leaf • Salt and pepper to taste In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. • Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). • Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent. • Add beef cubes and cook until browned on all sides. • Sprinkle flour over the beef and stir to combine. • Add red wine, beef broth, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf. • Bring to a simmer, then cover and transfer to the oven. • Cook for 2 hours, adding mushrooms, carrots, and pearl onions in the last 30 minutes. • Season with salt and pepper to taste. • Serve warm.

o 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast o 1 teaspoon sugar o 1 cup warm water o 3 cups flour o 1 teaspoon salt o 1/4 cup olive oil o 1/4 cup za'atar o Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water, let sit until foamy. o Mix flour and salt in a bowl, then add yeast mixture and olive oil. o Knead until smooth, then let rise until doubled. o Divide dough into balls and roll out into circles. o Spread za'atar mixed with olive oil on top. o Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden. o Serve warm.

o 1 small onion o 2 cloves garlic o 1 bell pepper o 4 tomatoes o 1 teaspoon cumin o 1 teaspoon paprika o 1 teaspoon salt o 4 eggs o 1/4 cup parsley o Sauté diced onion, minced garlic, and diced bell pepper until softened. o Add diced tomatoes, cumin, paprika, and salt, simmer for 10 minutes. o Make wells in the sauce and crack eggs into each well. o Cover and cook until eggs are set. o Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

• 1 beef roast (3-4 pounds) • 2 cloves garlic, minced • 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, chopped • 1 tablespoon fresh thyme, chopped • 1/4 cup olive oil • Salt and pepper to taste • Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a bowl, mix minced garlic, chopped rosemary, chopped thyme, olive oil, salt, and pepper. • Rub the mixture over the beef roast. • Place the roast in a roasting pan and cook for 1 hour and 30 minutes until desired doneness. Let rest before slicing and serving.

In a bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, and pepper. • Gradually whisk in beer until smooth. • Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 350°F (175°C). • Dip fish fillets in the batter and fry until golden and crispy. • Drain on paper towels. • Fry potatoes until golden and crispy. • Serve fish and chips with lemon wedges.
